trans-unit.source: Payload Format for Table Service Operations
trans-unit.target: Payload Format for Table Service Operations

trans-unit.source: The Table service REST API supports ATOM and JSON as OData payload formats.
trans-unit.target: The Table service REST API supports ATOM and JSON as OData payload formats.

trans-unit.source: While the ATOM protocol is supported for all versions of the Azure storage services, the JSON protocol is supported only for versions greater than 2013-08-15.
trans-unit.target: While the ATOM protocol is supported for all versions of the Azure storage services, the JSON protocol is supported only for versions greater than 2013-08-15.

trans-unit.source: The following REST API operations are not OData APIs and do not currently do not support JSON: <link xlink:href="4131c1c3-8605-4bcb-9e85-e1a8ac7f17c6" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Table ACL (REST API)</link>, <link xlink:href="a68b978f-5cbe-4275-b42a-68b7f88ee968" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Table ACL (REST API)</link>, <link xlink:href="99806684-7d33-4a59-acc2-23aaf460eb31" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Table Service Properties (REST API)</link>, and <link xlink:href="aff6740b-6ea5-4548-b226-322eb76dad94" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Table Service Properties (REST API)</link>.
trans-unit.target: The following REST API operations are not OData APIs and do not currently do not support JSON: <link xlink:href="4131c1c3-8605-4bcb-9e85-e1a8ac7f17c6" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Table ACL (REST API)</link>, <link xlink:href="a68b978f-5cbe-4275-b42a-68b7f88ee968" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Table ACL (REST API)</link>, <link xlink:href="99806684-7d33-4a59-acc2-23aaf460eb31" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Table Service Properties (REST API)</link>, and <link xlink:href="aff6740b-6ea5-4548-b226-322eb76dad94" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Table Service Properties (REST API)</link>.

trans-unit.source: To specify the ATOM or JSON format, specify the appropriate values for the <parameterReference>Content-Type</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>Accept</parameterReference> headers (described below).
trans-unit.target: To specify the ATOM or JSON format, specify the appropriate values for the <parameterReference>Content-Type</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>Accept</parameterReference> headers (described below).

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>Content-Type</parameterReference> header is required for all requests containing an OData payload.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>Content-Type</parameterReference> header is required for all requests containing an OData payload.

trans-unit.source: If the <parameterReference>Accept</parameterReference> header is not provided, then the content type of the response defaults to <codeInline>application/atom+xml</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: If the <parameterReference>Accept</parameterReference> header is not provided, then the content type of the response defaults to <codeInline>application/atom+xml</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Specifying the <codeInline>$format</codeInline> URI parameter overrides the value specified in the <parameterReference>Accept</parameterReference> request header, when the OData data service version is set to 3.0.
trans-unit.target: Specifying the <codeInline>$format</codeInline> URI parameter overrides the value specified in the <parameterReference>Accept</parameterReference> request header, when the OData data service version is set to 3.0.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="086d4db0-0743-4987-b8a7-2cd15090dfd6" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Setting the OData Data Service Version Headers</link> for details about the OData service version.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="086d4db0-0743-4987-b8a7-2cd15090dfd6" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Setting the OData Data Service Version Headers</link> for details about the OData service version.

trans-unit.source: To specify the payload format, set the <parameterReference>Content-Type</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>Accept</parameterReference> request headers according to the table below:
trans-unit.target: To specify the payload format, set the <parameterReference>Content-Type</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>Accept</parameterReference> request headers according to the table below:

trans-unit.source: For details, see the <embeddedLabel>JSON Format</embeddedLabel> section below.
trans-unit.target: For details, see the <embeddedLabel>JSON Format</embeddedLabel> section below.

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>Atom</linkText><linkUri>http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4287</linkUri></externalLink> is an XML-based document format that describes collections of related information referred to as <newTerm>feeds</newTerm>.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>Atom</linkText><linkUri>http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4287</linkUri></externalLink> is an XML-based document format that describes collections of related information referred to as <newTerm>feeds</newTerm>.

trans-unit.source: Feeds are composed of a number of items, known as <newTerm>entries</newTerm>.
trans-unit.target: Feeds are composed of a number of items, known as <newTerm>entries</newTerm>.

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>AtomPub</linkText><linkUri>http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5023</linkUri></externalLink> defines additional format constructs for entries and feeds so that the resources they represent may be easily categorized, grouped, edited, and discovered.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>AtomPub</linkText><linkUri>http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5023</linkUri></externalLink> defines additional format constructs for entries and feeds so that the resources they represent may be easily categorized, grouped, edited, and discovered.

trans-unit.source: However, since Atom does not define how structured data is encoded with feeds, <externalLink><linkText>OData</linkText><linkUri>http://www.odata.org/</linkUri></externalLink> defines a set of conventions for representing structured data in an Atom feed in order to enable transfers of structured content by services based on OData.
trans-unit.target: However, since Atom does not define how structured data is encoded with feeds, <externalLink><linkText>OData</linkText><linkUri>http://www.odata.org/</linkUri></externalLink> defines a set of conventions for representing structured data in an Atom feed in order to enable transfers of structured content by services based on OData.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following sample OData entry demonstrates the Atom format sent through a request to insert an entity into Azure Table storage using the REST API (see <link xlink:href="9ca046aa-e9b4-4eaf-a7c0-d6ccdbaf48b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Insert Entity (REST API)</link> for details on the insert operation):
trans-unit.target: For example, the following sample OData entry demonstrates the Atom format sent through a request to insert an entity into Azure Table storage using the REST API (see <link xlink:href="9ca046aa-e9b4-4eaf-a7c0-d6ccdbaf48b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Insert Entity (REST API)</link> for details on the insert operation):

trans-unit.source: When a client queries a set of entities in Table storage, the service responds with an Atom feed, which is a collection of Atom entries (see <link xlink:href="8cfef6f9-eb7f-40f0-9016-dff44d36b6e1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Entities (REST API)</link> for details on the query operation):
trans-unit.target: When a client queries a set of entities in Table storage, the service responds with an Atom feed, which is a collection of Atom entries (see <link xlink:href="8cfef6f9-eb7f-40f0-9016-dff44d36b6e1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Entities (REST API)</link> for details on the query operation):

trans-unit.source: Property Types in an Atom Feed
trans-unit.target: Property Types in an Atom Feed

trans-unit.source: Property data types are defined by the <externalLink><linkText>OData Protocol Specification</linkText><linkUri>http://www.odata.org/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Property data types are defined by the <externalLink><linkText>OData Protocol Specification</linkText><linkUri>http://www.odata.org/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Not all data types defined by the specification are supported by the Table service.
trans-unit.target: Not all data types defined by the specification are supported by the Table service.

trans-unit.source: For information about the supported data types and how they map to common language runtime (CLR) types, see <link xlink:href="01f78ed1-9cbd-4b00-8113-71129751357e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Understanding the Table Service Data Model</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about the supported data types and how they map to common language runtime (CLR) types, see <link xlink:href="01f78ed1-9cbd-4b00-8113-71129751357e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Understanding the Table Service Data Model</link>.

trans-unit.source: A property may be specified with or without an explicit data type.
trans-unit.target: A property may be specified with or without an explicit data type.

trans-unit.source: If the type is omitted, the property is automatically created as data type <languageKeyword>Edm.String</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: If the type is omitted, the property is automatically created as data type <languageKeyword>Edm.String</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: If a property is created with an explicit type, a query that returns the entity includes that type within the Atom feed, so that you can determine the type of an existing property if necessary.
trans-unit.target: If a property is created with an explicit type, a query that returns the entity includes that type within the Atom feed, so that you can determine the type of an existing property if necessary.

trans-unit.source: Knowing a property's type is important when you are constructing a query that filters on that property.
trans-unit.target: Knowing a property's type is important when you are constructing a query that filters on that property.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="74e73539-b624-4f47-8603-112cbb6780db" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Querying Tables and Entities</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="74e73539-b624-4f47-8603-112cbb6780db" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Querying Tables and Entities</link>.

trans-unit.source: OData extends the JSON format by defining general conventions for these name-value pairs, similar to the ATOM format described above.
trans-unit.target: OData extends the JSON format by defining general conventions for these name-value pairs, similar to the ATOM format described above.

trans-unit.source: OData defines a set of canonical annotations for control information such as IDs, type, and links.
trans-unit.target: OData defines a set of canonical annotations for control information such as IDs, type, and links.

trans-unit.source: For details about the JSON format, see <externalLink><linkText>Introducing JSON</linkText><linkUri>http://www.json.org/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For details about the JSON format, see <externalLink><linkText>Introducing JSON</linkText><linkUri>http://www.json.org/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The key advantage of using OData's JSON format is that the predictable parts of the payload can be omitted to reduce the payload size.
trans-unit.target: The key advantage of using OData's JSON format is that the predictable parts of the payload can be omitted to reduce the payload size.

trans-unit.source: To reconstitute this data on the receiving end, expressions are used to compute missing links, type information, and control data.
trans-unit.target: To reconstitute this data on the receiving end, expressions are used to compute missing links, type information, and control data.

trans-unit.source: To control what is omitted from the payload, there are three levels that you can specify as part of the <parameterReference>Accept</parameterReference> header:
trans-unit.target: To control what is omitted from the payload, there are three levels that you can specify as part of the <parameterReference>Accept</parameterReference> header:

trans-unit.source: The following ODATA annotations are supported by the Azure Table service:
trans-unit.target: The following ODATA annotations are supported by the Azure Table service:

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>odata.metadata</languageKeyword>: The metadata URL for a collection, entity, primitive value, or service document.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>odata.metadata</languageKeyword>: The metadata URL for a collection, entity, primitive value, or service document.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>odata.id</languageKeyword>: The entity id which is generally the URL to the resource.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>odata.id</languageKeyword>: The entity id which is generally the URL to the resource.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>odata.editlink</languageKeyword>: The link used to edit/update the entry, if the entity is updatable and the odata.id does not represent a URL that can be used to edit the entity.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>odata.editlink</languageKeyword>: The link used to edit/update the entry, if the entity is updatable and the odata.id does not represent a URL that can be used to edit the entity.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>odata.type</languageKeyword>: The type name of the containing object.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>odata.type</languageKeyword>: The type name of the containing object.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>PropertyName@odata.type</languageKeyword>, for custom properties: The type name of the targeted property.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>PropertyName@odata.type</languageKeyword>, for custom properties: The type name of the targeted property.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>PropertyName@odata.type</languageKeyword>, for system properties (<legacyItalic>i.e.</legacyItalic>, the <languageKeyword>PrimaryKey</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>RowKey</languageKeyword>, and <languageKeyword>Timestamp</languageKeyword> properties): The type name of the targeted property.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>PropertyName@odata.type</languageKeyword>, for system properties (<legacyItalic>i.e.</legacyItalic>, the <languageKeyword>PrimaryKey</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>RowKey</languageKeyword>, and <languageKeyword>Timestamp</languageKeyword> properties): The type name of the targeted property.

trans-unit.source: The information included in each level is summarized in the following table:
trans-unit.target: The information included in each level is summarized in the following table:

trans-unit.source: Property Types in a JSON Feed
trans-unit.target: Property Types in a JSON Feed

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>odata.type</languageKeyword> annotation is used in the OData JSON format to determine the type of an open property.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>odata.type</languageKeyword> annotation is used in the OData JSON format to determine the type of an open property.

trans-unit.source: This annotation is present when all of the conditions below are satisfied:
trans-unit.target: This annotation is present when all of the conditions below are satisfied:

trans-unit.source: The JSON control level is set to either <codeInline>odata=minimalmetadata</codeInline> or <codeInline>odata=fullmetadata</codeInline>, as discussed in the <embeddedLabel>JSON Format</embeddedLabel> section.
trans-unit.target: The JSON control level is set to either <codeInline>odata=minimalmetadata</codeInline> or <codeInline>odata=fullmetadata</codeInline>, as discussed in the <embeddedLabel>JSON Format</embeddedLabel> section.

trans-unit.source: The property is a custom property.
trans-unit.target: The property is a custom property.

trans-unit.source: Note that for Azure tables, only the <languageKeyword>PartitionKey</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>RowKey</languageKeyword>, and <languageKeyword>Timestamp</languageKeyword> properties are system properties, and their type information is declared in <codeInline>$metadata</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Note that for Azure tables, only the <languageKeyword>PartitionKey</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>RowKey</languageKeyword>, and <languageKeyword>Timestamp</languageKeyword> properties are system properties, and their type information is declared in <codeInline>$metadata</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: The type annotation for these properties is present only when the control level is set to <codeInline>odata=fullmetadata</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The type annotation for these properties is present only when the control level is set to <codeInline>odata=fullmetadata</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: For more information see <link xlink:href="01f78ed1-9cbd-4b00-8113-71129751357e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Understanding the Table Service Data Model</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information see <link xlink:href="01f78ed1-9cbd-4b00-8113-71129751357e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Understanding the Table Service Data Model</link>.

trans-unit.source: The type of the property cannot be determined through the type detection heuristics summarized in the table below.
trans-unit.target: The type of the property cannot be determined through the type detection heuristics summarized in the table below.

trans-unit.source: The following JSON entity provides an example for each of the eight different property types:
trans-unit.target: The following JSON entity provides an example for each of the eight different property types:

trans-unit.source: Since <languageKeyword>PartitionKey</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>RowKey</languageKeyword> are system properties, meaning that all table rows must define these properties, their type annotation does not appear in the entity.
trans-unit.target: Since <languageKeyword>PartitionKey</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>RowKey</languageKeyword> are system properties, meaning that all table rows must define these properties, their type annotation does not appear in the entity.

trans-unit.source: These properties are predefined as type <languageKeyword>Edm.String</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: These properties are predefined as type <languageKeyword>Edm.String</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: However, the other properties are<languageKeyword ></languageKeyword>custom properties and therefore contain type information corresponding to one of the supported primitive types in the table above.
trans-unit.target: However, the other properties are<languageKeyword ></languageKeyword>custom properties and therefore contain type information corresponding to one of the supported primitive types in the table above.

trans-unit.source: The following sample OData entry demonstrates the JSON format sent as a request to insert an entity into Azure Table storage (see <link xlink:href="9ca046aa-e9b4-4eaf-a7c0-d6ccdbaf48b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Insert Entity (REST API)</link> for details on the insert operation):
trans-unit.target: The following sample OData entry demonstrates the JSON format sent as a request to insert an entity into Azure Table storage (see <link xlink:href="9ca046aa-e9b4-4eaf-a7c0-d6ccdbaf48b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Insert Entity (REST API)</link> for details on the insert operation):

trans-unit.source: When a client queries a set of entities in Azure Table storage, the service responds with a JSON payload (see <link xlink:href="8cfef6f9-eb7f-40f0-9016-dff44d36b6e1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Entities (REST API)</link> for details on the query operation).
trans-unit.target: When a client queries a set of entities in Azure Table storage, the service responds with a JSON payload (see <link xlink:href="8cfef6f9-eb7f-40f0-9016-dff44d36b6e1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Entities (REST API)</link> for details on the query operation).

trans-unit.source: The feed can include one of the three levels of information: no metadata, minimal metadata, or full metadata.
trans-unit.target: The feed can include one of the three levels of information: no metadata, minimal metadata, or full metadata.

trans-unit.source: The following examples demonstrate each kind:
trans-unit.target: The following examples demonstrate each kind:

trans-unit.source: To learn more about OData JSON format see the <externalLink><linkText>OData JSON Format Version 4.0</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=301473</linkUri></externalLink> specification, in conjunction with the <externalLink><linkText>[MS-ODATAJSON]: OData Protocol JSON Format Standards Support Document</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn260768.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: To learn more about OData JSON format see the <externalLink><linkText>OData JSON Format Version 4.0</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=301473</linkUri></externalLink> specification, in conjunction with the <externalLink><linkText>[MS-ODATAJSON]: OData Protocol JSON Format Standards Support Document</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn260768.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
